page.title: 05CHEW VALLEY LAKE SAILING
page.content: The lake is now a centre for small boat sailing on Wednesdays,Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays.The Summer sailing area is resticted because of the fishing season to 200 acres between North Shore, the Dam and Walley Bank with an extension to 300 acres on Sunday afternoons.During the Winter in the closed fishing season the sailing area is extended further to 500 acres passing Denny Island and Nunnery Point, ending before the Roman Shallows. The Sailing Club House and jetty is on Walley Bank near Woodford Lodge. The club has a full membership with many prospective members on a waiting list. The most popular type of two man boat is the Fireball and the most popular types of one man boat are the Laser,the Topper and the Solo.
